NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Crops and Export or the cell corresponding to Farm Management and Labor?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Crops} and {Export} has a higher heat value.

NC.Q: Which has the higher heat value: the cell corresponding to Poultry and Demand or the cell corresponding to Soil Health and Labor?
NC.A: The cell corresponding to {Poultry} and {Demand} has a higher heat value.

MSR.Q: In the heatmap, what are the row and column labels for all cells whose heat values fall within the range of 0.62 to 0.76?
MSR.A: The cells are: {(Farm Management, Cost), (Soil Health, Cost), (Crops, Demand), (Farming Techniques, Demand), (Poultry, Demand), (Water Usage, Demand), (Farm Management, Export), (Fisheries, Export), (Pest Control, Export), (Soil Health, Export), (Farming Techniques, Labor), (Forestry, Labor), (Livestock, Labor), (Poultry, Labor), (Fisheries, Regulations), (Pest Control, Regulations), (Fisheries, Sustainability), (Pest Control, Sustainability), (Farming Techniques, Technology Adoption), (Forestry, Technology Adoption), (Livestock, Technology Adoption), (Poultry, Technology Adoption), (Farm Management, Weather Impact), (Fisheries, Weather Impact), (Pest Control, Weather Impact), (Soil Health, Weather Impact), (Crops, Yield), (Farming Techniques, Yield), (Poultry, Yield), (Water Usage, Yield)}.
